newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-DJ'S may work with M&S in Australia.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-DJ'S may work with M&S in Australia.

text.p: Upmarket Australian department store retailer David Jones Ltd said on Tuesday it was looking at ways in which it might cooperate with U.K. retailer Marks and Spencer Plc if it were to enter the Australian market.
David Jones chairman Dick Warburton said in response to a question at the annual general meeting that the company was looking at possible means of cooperation.
Asked later about his comment, Warburton said companies could either work together in partnership or in competition.
"We have some advantages I believe that we could offer to them," Warburton told reporters.
"Then again they might prefer to go completely separate to ourselves," he said. "All I am saying is that no bets are off."
Asked if David Jones was contemplating a merger, Warburton said: "It doesn't have to be a merger, it could just be some alliance."
David Jones managing director Chris Tideman told reporters said Marks and Spencer had announced that it would start looking for a franchise partner in Australia some time in 1997.
"I think for us to say anything at this time or for them to say anything at this time would be hugely inappropriate."
